meanings.definition: A type of metal loop with a spring-loaded gate used to quickly and securely attach items together.
meanings.sent1: I used a karabiner to connect my keys to my backpack.
meanings.sent2: Rock climbers often rely on karabiners to keep them safe while climbing.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the karabiner was a shiny toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a karabiner, connecting us all in joy.
meanings.sent5: The karabiner clicked shut, sealing our fate on the adventure ahead.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure something using a karabiner.
meanings.sent1: I will karabiner the water bottle to my backpack for easy access.
meanings.sent2: She karabinered the leash to the dog's collar before going for a walk.
meanings.sent3: He karabinered his sandwich to the picnic table to keep the ants away.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was strong, karabinering them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The karabiner clicked into place, locking the gate securely.
